{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3492731,"name":"","username":"nstrike","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-25T23:44:42.386Z","cooked":"

Is this a typo or is REV no longer running the SparkMAX and SparkFlex period at 1kHz (like the TalonFX, and TalonFXS) and instead is running it at 100Hz?

With a PID loop onboard a SPARK Motor Controller, the setup is simple, doesn’t clutter your code, and the loop is updated every 10ms, doubling the responsiveness and precision of the controller. Even when using a more complex controller on the roboRIO, it’s still recommended to put as much processing on the motor controller as possible.

For reference it used to be every 1ms. Why change it to be significantly slower?

docs.revrobotics.com

Closed Loop Control | REVLib

Also why isnt the maxmotion max velocity used in MAXMotion velocity mode? It seems like a no brainer to override the velocity maximum in that case?

  • Updates MAXMotion velocity mode to ignore the MAXMotion max velocity parameter. This parameter is used for MAXMotion position mode only
GitHub

Release SPARK MAX v25.0.0-prerelease.9 · REVrobotics/REV-Software-Binaries

Fixes (Prerelease Regression) Fixed issue where SPARK MAX would not respond to input PWM signal Fixes issue where MAXMotion Velocity doesn't decelerate properly when a new setpoint value is less t...

Another weird thing is:

WPILib offers several sets of libraries to allow teams to run PID loops on the roboRIO, but they require setup in your team’s code and can only update every 20ms.

- Closed Loop Control | REVLib

This is inaccurate. Per Scheduling Functions at Custom Frequencies — FIRST Robotics Competition documentation

TimedRobot’s addPeriodic() method allows one to run custom methods at a rate faster than the default TimedRobot periodic update rate (20 ms). … Users can run feedback controllers more often than the main robot loop, but synchronously with the TimedRobot periodic functions, eliminating potential thread safety issues.

I’ve personally seen Java teams run on-RIO PID controllers at 100 Hz with this method.

The 10ms is a typo. The PID loop still runs at 1ms.

The reason for MAXMotion velocity mode not respecting the maximum velocity parameter is because that parameter would limit the setpoint that you pass in for velocity mode, and if the user doesn’t know to set the max velocity parameter, the default of 0 will prevent any motion at all.

You could have it set to a default of Double.MAX_VALUE or something, that way it doesn’t affect the user that doesn’t touch that setting.

jan:

if the user doesn’t know to set the max velocity parameter, the default of 0 will prevent any motion at all.

Honestly i dont see a problem with this, it can be explicitly pointed out in the docs and any support questions over email, and we can link to that page on CD, Discord or wherever?

Or throw an error in REV Lib saying it needs to be set?

It seems like one of those design choices where they wanted to avoid someone making a CD thread about their product’s weird behavior, only to create a different weird behavior that someone made a CD thread about.

","post_number":6,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-26T04:13:53.506Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":5,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":2,"reads":253,"readers_count":252,"score":60.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":483639,"topic_slug":"why-is-rev-pid-significantly-slower-now","display_username":"evanperryg","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":51887,"username":"nstrike","name":"","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/nstrike/{size}/167038_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":20861,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"1732 ← 3007 ← 2338"},"post_url":"/t/why-is-rev-pid-significantly-slower-now/483639/6","custom_user_title":"1732 ← 3007 ← 2338","reactions":[{"id":"laughing","type":"emoji","count":4}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":4,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3493875,"name":"","username":"jan","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/jan/{size}/158811_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-27T18:33:50.158Z","cooked":"

For a bit more clarity, the previous behavior was just a clamp on the setpoint, and we thought it was redundant to have a parameter limit a value that the user has 100% control over. In addition, silently applying a limit to your setpoint magnitude in firmware, away from the place you’re setting the setpoint, is objectively unintuitive and can potentially hide the source of the bug by not being in user code.

For example, to have a velocity setpoint of 3000 RPM, the user would need make sure that they set the max velocity parameter to 3000 or greater. If the max velocity is set to 3000, and the user decides to use a setpoint greater than 3000, then they would also need to ensure they update that maximum value in the config.

In addition, if the clamping behavior is what you want, that can be done in user code with a simple Math.min(kMaxVelocity, setpoint), which is more or less what firmware did. I see no real benefit to have this being done on the controller side, other than saving teams a few lines of code IF that is the behavior that a team wants.

It doesn’t make sense for MAXMotion position mode to have a max position parameter that clamps their setpoint, so why would velocity mode need the max velocity parameter?

viggy96:

You could have it set to a default of Double.MAX_VALUE or something, that way it doesn’t affect the user that doesn’t touch that setting.

That also affects the user that doesn’t touch that setting when using MAXMotion position mode. Sure, they would need to set max acceleration, but in the edge case that they set that and not max velocity, you’re risking breaking their mechanism or causing potential danger, defeating the whole purpose of motion profiling.

I personally can’t think of any examples where max velocity is useful in velocity mode, but I am open to ideas or counter examples. If the behavior that we chose is a real issue that is blocking teams or you disagree with our reasoning, please let us know, and we will revisit our change.

","post_number":7,"post_type":1,"posts_count":8,"updated_at":"2025-01-27T18:33:50.158Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":1,"incoming_link_count":11,"reads":184,"readers_count":183,"score":216.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":483639,"topic_slug":"why-is-rev-pid-significantly-slower-now","display_username":"","primary_group_name":"REV","flair_name":"REV","flair_url":"/uploads/default/original/3X/d/b/db93216ec14c273ae2ca04aa396186c0461d0620.png","flair_bg_color":"F05A28","flair_color":"","flair_group_id":55,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[{"id":2,"count":8}],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":49261,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"REV Software Engineer"},"post_url":"/t/why-is-rev-pid-significantly-slower-now/483639/7","custom_user_title":"REV Software Engineer","reactions":[{"id":"heart","type":"emoji","count":8}],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":8,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":true},{"id":3494492,"name":"Burak Demirelli","username":"burakdemirelli","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/burakdemirelli/{size}/235383_2.png","created_at":"2025-01-28T04:25:11.873Z","cooked":"

Hey, what is the recommended way to tune Max Motion? When we set the positionConversionFactor and velocityConversionFactor, does that change the units of the inputs for Max Motion? Cause we have converted everything to m/s and meters but still found out that the units made more sense in RPMs for Max Motion.

Also is there a limiting factor between the accel and vel? For example when we input 3000 for vel and something extremely high like 90 000 for accel, or the other way around the max motion would not run at all.

With a lot of tweaks, we could not get the trapezoidal motion to run on our elevator. In this case because the elevator cant get to cruise vel, it has to stop abruptly when it reaches the setpoint, which beats the entire purpose. Here is an example graph (red: velocity [m/s], blue: position of elev [meters], yellow: setpoint [meters]):

WhatsApp Image 2025-01-26 at 11.12.56840×755 67.6 KB

Even with a really high accel and vel value, we cant seem to get any trapezoidal shape and the elevator is oscillating extremely such as seen below:

Screenshot 2025-01-27 at 23.20.34884×1236 84.3 KB

I know that we are messing up something really basic, but is there way to approach how to set the best values for accel, vel, and P value? I realize vel and accel is more of a constraint rather than something to tune , but we were really confused as even really high values did not result in a trapezoid.
